post:
[Bug] nightwatch timeouts trying to connect to driver with 100 dockers

first this bug looks similar to https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/docker-selenium/issues/87 but I'm talking about latest nightwatch v1.2.1 and no selenium . ### Environment: * node.js v10 * nightwatch v1.2.1 * direct web driver (geko or chrome v76.0.3809.68) * chrome browser 76.0.3809.100 * all running inside a docker container (base image from ubuntu 16) The problem (probably a different solution than bug #87 mentioned above). When you deploy dozens of nightwatch containers , when they all try to connect to the browser in some cases it will work (slowly) but in other cases it will look like this: ### Verbose output  if you lower the number of concurrent nightwatch dockers on that host (lets say 10): it will succeed eventually. This is not a DBUS issue or a docker setting specific issue. It is simply the load of new connections and unix forks/spawn the nightwatch is creating in a large Kubernetes deployments. after investigating: when deploying nightwatch v1.2+ on a docker image in a large scale (Kubernetes) it will demand more resources than older version (v0.9+). you might need to increase the K8s max file handlers (ulimit and alike) to allow larger fork count and I/O connections. Furthermore, the K8s hosting machine will probably take more time to connect to the web chrome driver instance (or geko) . What used to be 100 milisec on a single instance will increase to 10,000 ms when run along many other nightwatch containers. So the solution for this swarm type is to increase timeouts. The bug was easily reproduced in a Jenkins environment when the number of Jenkins executors for the nightwatch job was higher than 80. ### Configuration  ### How to Reproduce:  ### Sample test my-nightwatch-test.sh may simply run this test: simple open a browser to google.com $ nightwatch test/sampleTest.js --env chrome
question: Can you please follow the [Bug report issue template](https://github.com/nightwatchjs/nightwatch/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md)?

I keep getting a (wrong-type-argument stringp nil) error. After digging around for a while I've traced it to sesman-friendly-session-p in cider-connection.el that tries to compare-strings on a nil value thats coming from the classpath filtering. This is because nrepl-send-sync-request '("op" "classpath) ...) in cider-client.el gives me relative classpaths when running OpenJDK 10/11  While doing the same in OpenJDK 1.8 gives me absolutes:  Is this a known thing? post:
Windows 10 IoT leaves GPIO Pin to a different state than Raspbian

Raspberry PI 3 Model B Given 2 pieces of code that should behave the same, Windows 10 IoT (v. 10.0.17134.1) outcome is different from Raspbian one: I am not sure which one behaves correclty. **Please advise!** Pin under test is GPIO14 that has an internall pull-down resistor. **Code 1 - Python - Raspbian**  Read more: http://forum.switchdoc.com/thread/444/watchdog-reboots-system-4-seconds#ixzz5SWcd2Amx **Code 2 - .Net Core - Windows 10 IoT**  Folowing happens: **Raspbian** - When pin is set LOW Voltage goes to 0 - When pin is set as INPUT, Voltage increases slowly up to ~0.7 (then another cycle comes and is set to 0) - When the loop ends Voltage grows slowly up to 3.3V (actually it only reaches ~2.2 V because it is pulled down to ~1.1 from where it start growing again...) **Windows 10 IoT** - When pin is set LOW Voltage goes to 0 - When pin is set as INPUT, Voltage increases slowly up to ~0.7 (then another cycle comes and is set to 0) - **When the loop ends Voltage grows up to ~0.7 and stays there. It is not growing up to 3.3V...** I tried also setting: m_WatchdogPetPin.SetDriveMode(GpioPinDriveMode.InputPullUp); but then - When pin is set as INPUT, Voltage increases slowly up to 3.3V (actually it only reaches ~2.2 V because it is pulled down to ~1.1 from where it start growing again...) I have also posted here: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/1e51a5ec-96a1-4540-8efe-53960e471015/raspberry-pi-3-model-b-windows-10-iot-leaves-gpio-pin-to-a-different-state-than-raspbian?forum=WindowsIoT and here: https://github.com/ms-iot/bsp/issues/44 looking for the people who better know what is under the hood.
question: Do you get the same result with a finite loop? Do you get the same result without the loop altogether?
answer: (actually it only reaches ~2.2 V because it is pulled down to ~1.1 from where it start growing again...) (actually it only reaches ~2.2 V because it is pulled down to ~1.1 from where it start growing again...)

post:
Use __annotations__ to decide type of dynamic attributes as specified in PEP526

https://github.com/davidhalter/jedi/issues/1347 is related to this and already uses this for return types implemented via https://github.com/davidhalter/jedi/commit/aa2dc6be09da315ff8ca28553fde0bda01ee0132 It seems that accessing and parsing __annotations__ is thus something that is considered useful for Interpreter contexts. This would also be another way to deal with issues like #1453 or https://github.com/davidhalter/jedi/issues/1378 that are currently dealt with via https://github.com/davidhalter/jedi/commit/923fcf95d991286302a6233eb4eb760b02fad1e3 which is not an ideal solution compared to this IMO My suggestion is to also parse __annotations__ on objects and classes and thus support [PEP526: Class and instance variable annotations](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0526/#class-and-instance-variable-annotations). Those are mostly ignored by the runtime and can be used to provide type information to IDEs and completers to specify that some attribute that might be hidden behind some __getattr__ magic or similar has a certain type without having to actually run the code (as is currently done). This should also allow to infer the type of an attribute that is e.g. declared as List[T] which could otherwise only be annotated if turning it into a property and annotating the property itself. Examples:   It must be noted that according to [PEP 563](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0563/) those annotations will always be strings that have to be [resolved](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0563/#id7). Without the from __future__ import annotations the dict contains the class/type directly. PoC/Test:
question: What do you think?
answer: , attrif attr == 'some_dynamic_attribute': return SomeClass(1,'foobar') def __dir__(self): DynamicVarClass(object): some_dynamic_attribute: Class def __getattr__(self, attr): if attr == 'some_dynamic_attribute': return SomeClass(1,'foobar') def __dir__(self): return ['some_dynamic_attribute'] + object.__dir__(self) c = DynamicVar

## Important info * URL to affected spec: [Example spec](https://w3c.github.io/navigation-timing/?isPreview=true&prNumber=23) * ReSpec version: 25.1.0 * [x] I did a "hard refresh", but it's still busted. ## Description of problem **What happened?:** Unexpected error in respec pill. **But what I was expecting?:** No errors. ### Steps to reproduce: 1. Add ?isPreview=true&prNumber=23 to a spec. For example, https://w3c.github.io/navigation-timing/ becomes https://w3c.github.io/navigation-timing/?isPreview=true&prNumber=23. Alternatively, add {isPreview=true, prNumber: 23} to a spec's config in local 2. Visit the link 3. The title should say something like Preview of PR #23: Navigation Timing Level 2 4. There is one red error in the respec pill.  5. This is because Respec seems to think that #23 is a reference to some definition and tries to resolve it. 6. Ideally #23 should link to the PR itself. Regardless, even if it doesn't link to anything, #23 it shouldn't be flagged as a citation error. Thanks for confirming that this is a bug and not expected behaviour, @sidvishnoi!
question: How did you reach the above config without getting prUrl?
answer: . Alternatively, add {isPreview=true, prNumber: 23} to a spec's config in local

post:
articles yml does not control articles section dropdown menu

This issue is similar to #995 and #325 This minimal example shows what appears to be a problem the yml for controlling the dropdown navigation for articles. The yml below should do the following, but it does not: 1) rename the "articles" tab, 2) write a line of text in the article dropdown tab, and 3) re-order the listed articles to show Article2 before Article1. Additionally, deleting one of the articles from the list under menu does not eliminate it from the dropdown navigation.  link to minimal example: [https://github.com/CrumpLab/pkgdownMenuProblem](https://github.com/CrumpLab/pkgdownMenuProblem) Many apologies if this has already been solved. I've attempted to read all of the issues and documentation, and still can't get it to work, so started to wonder if there was a bug, thanks for all the great work on pkgdown!

post:
Calabash is not linked to built IPA?

Hi, I followed [this](https://github.com/calabash/calabash-ios/wiki/Tutorial%3A-Calabash-config) guide for linking Calabash to my non-Xamarin.iOS project, and when running it directly from Xcode, my Xamarin.UITest's run fine. However, I want to build it as an IPA so I can submit it to VS App Center for testing. It seems that Calabash is not linked in the IPA, even though I targeted my new scheme. After I locally install the IPA and run my UITest: System.Exception : Unable to contact test backend running in app. A common cause is that the app is not properly linked with Calabash. Please verify that it includes the Calabash component. Sure enough: calabash-ios check Calabash.ipa shows it is not linked. A lot of posts recommend adding Xamarin.Calabash.Start(), though this is not a Xamarin.iOS project. It's actually a Unity project, I've embedded an HTTP server to act as the middleman, and it works quite well locally. I cannot understand if Calabash cannot be linked in the IPA, how am I supposed to upload a non Xamarin.iOS project to VS App Center? Any advise is appreciated. Regards, Loren
question: How are you building the .ipa?
answer: Sure enough: calabash-ios check Calabash.ipa shows it is not linked.

post:
\blx@sectionciteorder@1 counter undefined with \includeonly

*For the benefit of people who were sent here by a websearch for the LaTeX error message . Like #361 this question is about a bug in an ancient version of biblatex that would cause such an error message. The bug has long been resolved (in version 2.9a). This bug report contains no further information on how to deal with a generic error like . A common cause of this error is an undefined counter (as was the case here). If you need help with your document, you may want to consider asking the comp.text.tex newsgroup or at https://latex.org/ or https://tex.stackexchange.com/.* I am trying to compile a document with each chapter in a separate file, and included in the main file. Each chapter has a bibliography, so I am using refsection=chapter. I'm using biblatex 2.9 and biber 1.9. The following mwe throws an error if the \includeonly is not commented out:  As mentioned, the file mwe1.tex contains simply  The exact errors are:  If I use bibtex instead of biber as the backend, the errors disappear too. The following compilation steps produce the error starting with only the two files above in the directory:  According to a comment on http://tex.stackexchange.com/q/184288, 'the source of the problem is that in \blx@endrefsection@biber biblatex tries to advance a counter which is created by the patched \@makechapterhead and so doesn't exists when you "hide" later on chapters with \includeonly.'
question: Could you try this with the 3.0 dev version on Sourceforge? I don't see this error with the steps you mention with this version.
answer: *For the benefit of people who were sent here by a websearch for the LaTeX error message . Like #361 this question is about a bug in an ancient version of biblatex that would cause such an error message. The bug has long been resolved (in version 2.9a). This bug report contains no further information on how to deal with a generic error like . A common cause of this error is an undefined counter (as was the case here). post:
Parameters of bytea type cannot be converted to string

**I'm submitting a ...** <!--- What kind of an issue is this? Put an x in all the boxes that apply: --> - [ ] bug report - [x] feature request **Describe the issue** Parameters of the bytea format cannot be converted to a string using toString. Bytea is a binary data type, so its conversion is handled in this switch https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/blob/b7fd9f3cef734b4c219e2f6bc6c19acf68b2990b/pgjdbc/src/main/java/org/postgresql/core/v3/SimpleParameterList.java#L176, however there isn't a case for Oid.BYTEA. The implementation should be fairly easy using PGbytea.toPGString. This causes problems when using preferQueryMode=simple with bytea parameters, since PreparedStatement::toString relies on the parameters being convertible to string. **Driver Version?** 42.2.3 **Java Version?** Java 8 and 11 **OS Version?** Ubuntu 18.04 **PostgreSQL Version?** PostgresSQL 11 **To Reproduce** 1. Connect to a DB using preferQueryMode=simple 2. Insert a row containing a bytea attribute

post:
Possible IRSA dust query bug: inconsistent handling of sky coordinate formats

Firstly, I'm a first time commenter so my apologies if the format of this post isn't right. I'm using astroquery.irsa_dust for my research and am having some problems using get_query_table. I'm trying to open a number of identically-formatted data tables, retrieve the RA and Dec and then query IRSA dust for the extinction data (I'm using get_query_table rather than get_extinction_table as I'm specifically after just the colour excess). The code is shown below: from astroquery.irsa_dust import IrsaDust import astropy.units as u from astropy import coordinates import os from astropy.io import ascii for filename in os.listdir('./Data'): fp = open('./Data/{0}'.format(filename)) for line in fp: if line[0:2] == 'RA': RA = line.split()[1] if line[0:4] == 'DECL': Dec = line.split()[1] break print(RA,Dec) co = coordinates.SkyCoord(ra=RA, dec = Dec, unit=(u.deg,u.deg)) print(co) table = IrsaDust.get_query_table(co,section='ebv') I have a small subset of data in a folder called Initial_Data, and when I use this folder instead the code works perfectly. However, when using the full set of data as in the code above I get the following error: runfile('/home/matt/Documents/Lightcurves/extinction.py', wdir='/home/matt/Documents/Lightcurves') 53.599800 -28.714764 <SkyCoord (ICRS): (ra, dec) in deg (53.5998, -28.714764)> Traceback (most recent call last): File "<ipython-input-4-449177a18559>", line 1, in <module> runfile('/home/matt/Documents/Lightcurves/extinction.py', wdir='/home/matt/Documents/Lightcurves') File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/spyder_kernels/customize/spydercustomize.py", line 668, in runfile execfile(filename, namespace) File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/spyder_kernels/customize/spydercustomize.py", line 108, in execfile exec(compile(f.read(), filename, 'exec'), namespace) File "/home/matt/Documents/Lightcurves/extinction.py", line 20, in <module> table = IrsaDust.get_query_table(co,section='ebv') File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/astroquery/irsa_dust/core.py", line 299, in get_query_table xml_tree = utils.xml(response.text) File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/astroquery/irsa_dust/utils.py", line 119, in xml raise Exception("The dust service responded with an error: " + message) Exception: The dust service responded with an error: ERROR: required input [location] is missing. No matter which table I start with, the error always occurs on the first one. I know that RA and Dec are being retrieved correctly and that the coordinates object is being created, so I don't understand why this error occurs. I have checked for a number of different coordinates on the IRSA website and there is data available. I have also tried retrieving the coordinates and inputting them as a string but this still doesn't work. I have also looked at the data set that does work and still notice some irregularities. The code works when defining a coordinates.SkyCoord object as above but putting in the same coordinates as a string gives the same error: In [6]: co Out[6]: <SkyCoord (ICRS): (ra, dec) in deg (34.906941, -6.071715)> In [7]: table = IrsaDust.get_query_table(co,section='ebv') In [8]: table = IrsaDust.get_query_table('2h19m37.67 -6d4m18.17s',section='ebv') /home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/astroquery/utils/commons.py:162: UserWarning: Coordinate string is being interpreted as an ICRS coordinate. warnings.warn("Coordinate string is being interpreted as an " Traceback (most recent call last): File "<ipython-input-8-f8614cacb31e>", line 1, in <module> table = IrsaDust.get_query_table('2h19m37.67 -6d4m18.17s',section='ebv') File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/astroquery/irsa_dust/core.py", line 299, in get_query_table xml_tree = utils.xml(response.text) File "/home/matt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/astroquery/irsa_dust/utils.py", line 119, in xml raise Exception("The dust service responded with an error: " + message) Exception: The dust service responded with an error: ERROR: required input [location] is missing. Essentially, I have two questions. 1) Why does the first section of code work for one set of table data but not for another set of identically formatted data? 2) Why does one coordinate not work as a string when it works as a SkyCoords object and as a string on the IRSA dust website? I'm not sure if there's something else I could have done wrong or if there's a bug in the code. I've had others look who have more experience and they can't see what's going wrong. Thank you very much for your time, please let me know if there's anything else I can provide that would be helpful.

post:
sync_file_range02 failed

Hi, I've got the following failed message when running case sync_file_range02: sync_file_range02.c:74: FAIL: Sync inside of write: Synced 22282240, expected 16777216 sync_file_range02.c:74: FAIL: Sync overlaps with write: Synced 9699328, expected 8388608 Before commit b928910ca769 "syscalls/sync_file_range: add partial file sync test-cases", the case is PASS. I've noticed that this commit has changed the PASS condition: Before: written >= FILE_SIZE After: (written >= tc->exp_sync_size) && (written <= (tc->exp_sync_size + tc->exp_sync_size/10)) I'm not sure why we set a threshold 10%. And I think it has missed some scenarios. My kernel is 4.19.67, using ext4, and this issue can only be found in debug kernel.
question: Can you include some details here? Such as distribution/kernel version the test output when it failed etc. We can hardly do anything without this information.
answer: Hi, I've got the following failed message when running case sync_file_range02: sync_file_range02.c:74: FAIL: Sync inside of write: Synced 22282240, expected 16777216 sync_file_range02.c:74: FAIL: Sync overlaps with write: Synced 9699328, expected 8388608 Before commit b928910ca769 "syscalls/sync_file_range: add partial file sync test-cases", the case is PASS. I've noticed that this commit has changed the PASS condition: Before: written >= FILE_SIZE After: (written >= tc->exp_sync_size) && (written <= (tc->exp_sync_size + tc->exp_sync_size/10)) I'm not sure why we set a threshold 10%. And I think it has missed some scenarios. My kernel is 4.19.67, and this issue can only be found in debug kernel.

post:
ScanStruct and nested struct

If there is a structure inside the structure, the fields after the nested structure are not scanned correctly. The fix is to check the field kind(), skip nested structure conversion, and return nil. This issue has been resolved with the redis:"-" tag feature.
question: Do you have an example of this issue?
answer: This issue has been resolved with the redis:"-" tag feature.

post:
Collaborative Editing & Federation

# OnlyOffice + Federation Current state: - When editing a document shared via federation between two oC instances that connect to the same OnlyOffice instance every user gets their own session => collaborative editing does not work, simultaneous editing overwrites changes from others by the last user closing OnlyOffice - When editing a document shared via federation between two oC instances that do not connect to the same OnlyOffice instance or use another collaborative editing solution => same issue as above but different case in terms of finding a solution ## Approach 1: All federated instances connect to one OnlyOffice instance => Unique shared file identifier - Issue 1: Only solves the scenario when federated instances are connected to the same OnlyOffice instance - Issue 2: Does not cover other collaborative editing solutions ## Approach 2: Generalized approach - Find a solution that works for all collaborative editing solutions (Collabora Online / Office Online) - Find a solution that works when federated instances use different instances of the same collaborative editing solution - Find a solution that works when federated instances use different collaborative editing solutions => Use co-editing solution of the owner's oC instance? # Importing Public Links as federated shares from the same instance they originate from ## Approach 1: Convert to user share - How to handle permissions? - How to handle links with expiration date/password? - Will the public link be removed after conversion? - Do we need to ask the owner for permission before conversion? - Old ticket about the case https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/9090
question: Should the share import fail ?
answer: Current state: - When editing a document shared via federation between two oC instances that connect to the same OnlyOffice instance every user gets their own session => collaborative editing does not work, simultaneous editing overwrites changes from others by the last user closing OnlyOffice - When editing a document shared via federation between two oC instances that do not connect to the same OnlyOffice instance or use another collaborative editing solution => same issue as above but different case in terms of finding a solution

post:
Incorrect HTTP status code returned when pending shares are unsuccessfully declined

### Steps to reproduce 1. Attempt to decline a pending share twice or with a non-existant share id ### Expected behaviour If the share has already been declined, then it would make more sense to return an HTTP 204 No Content. If the share id does not exist, then it would make more sense to return an HTTP 404 Not Found. ### Actual behaviour If an existing share has already been declined or if the share id provided does not exist, an HTTP 200 OK is returned. Yes, as can be seen in the response example below, if the share id cannot be found, the statuscode element in the XML response payload is set to 404. But the status code of the request should also be set appropriately.  #### Command Used  #### Sample Response  ### Server configuration **Operating system**: Ubuntu 18.04.2 **Web server:** Apache 2 **Database:** mariaDB **PHP version:** 7.2.19-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 **ownCloud version:** 10.2.1 **Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:** Fresh install **Where did you install ownCloud from:** owncloud-docker/server container **The content of config/config.php:**  **List of activated apps:**  **Are you using external storage, if yes which one:** local/smb/sftp/... no **Are you using encryption:** yes/no no **Are you using an external user-backend, if yes which one:** LDAP/ActiveDirectory/Webdav/... none ### Client configuration **Browser:** **Operating system:** ### Logs #### Web server error log  #### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)  #### Browser log
question: can you please add the full command + request + response? best is a curl with -v option

423 locked when retrying uploads with new endpoint

As you already know, we are currently [replacing the network library](https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/issues/51) in the Android app and I just noticed a strange behaviour when retrying an upload. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Upload a file with curl curl -X PUT -u user:password "url:port/remote.php/dav/files/user/video.mp4" -F myfile=@"./video.mp4" -v --progress-bar 2. Disconnect internet connection. 3. Wait for the curl timeout. 4. Reconnect internet. 5. Use the curl command in step 1 to upload the same file. ### Current behaviour **423 locked error**  ### Expected behaviour The upload is properly performed and the file is created in server receiving **204 No Content** code. ### Server configuration **Web server:** Apache 2.4.18 **Database:** MySQL **PHP version:** php7.0.28 **ownCloud version:** 10.0.7 (stable) ### Logs #### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)  ### Related issues (old endpoint) https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/17254 https://github.com/owncloudarchive/files_locking/issues/39

post:
Bow/crossbow strength requirements are unrealistic

<!-- Please follow the template below --> # Describe the bug The recent archery update seriously brought up both damage and strength requirements for bows and crossbows. I dunno about damage, buth the STR requirements seem very unrealistic. I keep in mind design values - an average human has 8 strength, a strong human has 10, a very strong person has 12, a top-tier athlete has 14. Look: 1. A 205 crossbow/200 lb composite crossbow requires 12 strength to draw, compound crossbow requires 11. [Here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2IdfmaC_t-Q) we have a man, drawing about 150 lbs with his bare hands, 300 lbs in sitting span and even more with very basic devices (**1500** lbs with a windlass, so the ingame heavy crossbow can be easily upped from the current 800 lbs). He's really not looking like a world-class athlete for me. 2. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2IdfmaC_t-Q) another average man drawing crossbows. Yes, he's using basic devices - goats foot lever, the spanning belt and the gaff lever, but they're like REALLY basic ones - every survivor should be able to use one. He claims you're able to draw about **450 lbs** this way. 3. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ohutwHqClOc) the guy drawing 80 lbs bows. 80 lb in-game bow requires 12 (!) strength, and the guy from the video is seriously not looking like the athlete or heavylifter. 4. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CoSCl_qcJsQ) a man with 110 lb bow (14 STR req). Yeah, he's definitely strong, but he's not a world-class powerlifter. 5. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-KokNtdh4_Y) a regular man easily drawing a 60 lb bow (10 STR req). Is he really about a half-way to the olympic championship? 6. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MjY2QrU4sm4) a strong man indeed drawing 210 lb bow. Ingame wooden 145 lb greatbow requires 19 (!) STR. Man from the video is not a cyborg or mutant, I'm sure. 7. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xrzPFIjAZdU) a 100 lb bow. 8. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WmhYwboqBOg) a 90 lb one. There are lots of evidences, I think you got the point - both bows and crossbows, despite the great drawing weight, do not require tremendous physical strength as they require now. # Steps To Reproduce 1. Start as an average person with 8-9 strength. 2. Spawn a compound bow (high), composite bow, reflex bow, hybrid longbow, crossbow or composite crossbow. 3. There's no way to shoot with them. # Expected behavior Able to shoot from a bow or crossbow. A bow/crossbow with req 12 or even 14 STR is probably a ballista or similar siege machine. I don't touch damage or range, because they are calculated by some complex formulas, but STR req is set arbitrary, so it can be changed more easily. The lower cap is currently 30 lbs with 10 lb/1 STR. I suppose to remove the cap - straight 10lb/1 STR would be fine: i.e. 6 STR person could draw a string of a 60-lb hunting bow, but stronger person would still benefit in bonus range. 8 STR person could draw a 80-lb bow, etc. Self bow - 30 lbs - I guess even a feeble person or a kid can draw 30 lbs. Short bow - 50 lbs - maybe leave it as is at 6 STR, I guess, or lower to 5. Compound bow (low) - 40 lbs - it seems even a feeble person is able to draw it. Compound bow (normal) - 60 lbs - lower the requirement to 6 STR. Compound bow (high) - 80 lbs - to 8 STR. Compound bows are very easy to draw thanks to a pulley system. Composite bow - 110 lbs - to 11 STR. Recurve bow/Reflex bow - 60 lbs - to 6 STR. Longbow - 80 lbs - to 8 STR. Wooden greatbow - 145 lbs - to 14 STR. Maybe 15 if it strictly designed for superhumans only. Compound greatbow - 120 lbs - to 12 STR. Reflex recurve bow - 50 lbs - to 5 STR. 8 STR max for all crossbows (and even without the req at all with drawing devices). TL;DR: 8-9 STR should be more than enough for most string weapons, more for the heaviest ones only.
question: What exactly is your problem, again?
answer: 6. [Here's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MjY2QrU4sm4) a strong man indeed drawing 210 lb bow. Ingame wooden 145 lb greatbow requires 19 (!) STR. Man from the video is not a cyborg or mutant, I'm sure.

post:
Proportional Ammunition Pierce

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Part of my archery re-balancing/improvements requires that arrows have proportional damage and piercing values that multiply the existing damage value of the bow they are fired from, with the intent of making archery more practical and realistic. As it stands, arrows and bows both have flat damage and pierce values. This is unrealistic and leads to inconsistent performance from different bows. While Knightosmaster was nice enough to add a proportional damage value, I still need a proportional pierce value to make my changes. **Describe the solution you'd like** Any and all "gun" items can have a pierce value applied to them in JSON. This represents the piercing value of a bow (or similar weapon) using a projectile with a terminal ballistic value of 1 (Or possibly 2, then non-bodkin arrows would reduce AP proportionally to bring them to appropriate levels. It depends on whether or not the base AP for the weakest bow is higher than 0). A "prop_pierce" value would then be needed on the ammunition in use, which multiplies the base pierce value of the bow it's fired from to give a final pierce value based on the input energy from the bow, and the terminal ballistics of the arrow itself. It's possible that I or others might make a mistake or simply not need to assign a pierce value to a weapon that might use proportional pierce ammo. If no pierce is assigned, the code would need to assume that the value is 0 and act appropriately. In practice, the idea is that I can have a bow marked with a base pierce value of 8. Firing a normal arrow out of it would apply the base pierce value of 8. A bodkin arrow with a prop_pierce value of 2 would be fired with an applied pierce value of 16. A crude wooden arrow with a prop_pierce value of 0.75 would be fired with an applied pierce value of 6. (Values are examples and not actual values for anything) **Describe alternatives you've considered** It's also possible that the appropriate pierce value could be drawn from the base damage of the weapon, then multiplied, but I feel that would make adding new content more difficult, requiring more math and messing about to get appropriate values. I could also just ignore proportional pierce entirely, but that leads to the current issue with bows and arrows. Namely, that a weak bow with high-quality arrows does dis-proportionally high damage and pierce. **Additional context** While I've mentioned primarily bows and arrows throughout this request, the same mechanic would obviously be applied to all similar weapons like crossbows, slingshots, and pneumatic weapons, which I also intend to take a stab at. The recent proportional damage PR from Knightosmaster does something similar, so could be quite helpful for direction. https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/pull/26705 The terminal ballistics and proportional damage values are drawn from Poragon's ranged weapon damage/pierce guideline which I've been working on applying to archery weapons. https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/issues/26183
question: How about we take a look at this rebalance before we add more currently unused features to support it?
answer: (Values are examples and not actual values for anything)

post: [Enhancement] Provide ability to remove the prefix="og: http://ogp.me/ns#" tag ## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. Yoast outputs a prefix tag: prefix="og: http://ogp.me/ns#" According to the OpenGraph protocol they _do not_ seem to say that specific prefix tag is explicitly needed: http://ogp.me/. Indeed, according to W3 it looks like you can just use og with the metadata rather than declaring the prefix: https://www.w3.org/2011/rdfa-context/rdfa-1.1 ## Describe the solution you'd like Provide ability to remove the prefix="og: http://ogp.me/ns#" tag if it is not needed ## why you think the feature request is something we should consider for the Yoast SEO plugins? Improve UX and Technical SEO
question: Why would we want to remove this, @Pcosta88?
answer: According to the OpenGraph protocol they _do not_ seem to say that specific prefix tag is explicitly needed: http://ogp.me/. Indeed, according to W3 it looks like you can just use og with the metadata rather than declaring the prefix: https://www.w3.org/2011/rdfa-context/rdfa-1.1

post:
Metabox modal

Product owner: @JessieHenkes UX designer: @hedgefield ### What are we going to build? We intend to move the metabox features to a modal. Not everything is smart to move to a modal, because the analysis and other related features are needed near the text when you're editing, you don't want to have to switch back and forth. Therefore, only the social previews, premium addons and advanced settings will go into the modal. ### What problem does it solve? In preparation for the 'Inline suggestions' project we wanted to move all metabox features to the GB sidebar, but this poses quite a few challenges (sidebar becomes cluttered and doesn't offer enough real estate). It also makes it easier to port Yoast SEO to other CMSes. ### Designs #### Functional prototype Desktop https://sketch.cloud/s/r0zwq/a/jdkzgm/play Mockup for mobile https://sketch.cloud/s/r0zwq/a/ZDz9YG #### Design files https://sketch.cloud/s/r0zwq #### Component specs https://github.com/Yoast/design/wiki ### Additional info or requirements The modal is a kind of mix between sidebar and metabox. Therefore existing elements should be able to be put into the modal without modification. In the mockup we've updated the UI of the elements to match our design kit. This doesn't change a whole lot about the existing design, mostly in the premium addons which were lagging behind in help-icons-for-explanation and consistent form fields department. The modal can be opened from the yoast sidebar, via a primary open post settings button that appears sticky at the top of the sidebar, as can be seen in the mockup. For mobile, the modal falls back to the accordeon layout that the items had in the metabox/sidebar to make sure it all fits inside the screen while not losing the quick navigation between sections. Mockup linked above. @Sjardo will set up the HTML and CSS for this and then pass it off to @Xyfi.
question: would you like us to develop this aswell? https://sketch.cloud/s/r0zwq/a/gw4Kgd
answer: . The modal can be opened from the yoast sidebar, via a primary open post settings button that appears sticky at the top of the sidebar, as can be seen in the mockup

post:
Add support and UI for 'reviewedBy' schema

Google is increasingly requiring that sites and pages demonstrate their expertise, authority and trustworthiness ('E-A-T'). A common SEO tactic to influence this is to have content be (visibly) 'reviewed' by professionals. This is particularly common in sensitive content categories, such as medical advice. See https://www.healthline.com/health/heart-attack for an example, where the content _author_ is a "Tricia Kinman", and the page is formally reviewed by "Elaine K. Luo, MD". The [reviewedBy](https://schema.org/reviewedBy) schema property (in conjunction with the [lastReviewed](https://schema.org/lastReviewed) property) allows us to describe this relationship explicitly. ## Requirements - [ ] On posts and pages, add a UI component to allow an editor to specify values for a 'Formal content review'. This requires them to select a _user_ and a _date_. - When a valid _user_ and _date_ are set: - [ ] Add a reviewedBy property to the WebPage, referencing the Person by ID. - [ ] Add a reviewedDate property to the WebPage, with the date value (in ISO 8601 date format). ## Considerations - The review data should be stored as conventional post meta, so that theme/plugin authors can easily retrieve and display them. - We may wish to explore additional requirements to add _qualifications_ (e.g., medical qualifications) to user profile fields, as well as adjusting how we output _titles_ (e.g., 'Dr') so as to enrich the _reviewer_ entity. ## Mockup I've thrown together an example mockup in the 'Advanced' section of the post editor. Feel free to challenge/ignore this! ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11629607/72327768-04c02000-36b2-11ea-8735-4a4f15865103.png) ## Credit Props to https://twitter.com/lilyraynyc for the idea.
question: Does that person need specifics on their profile? Like education, title, etc? Also... We *could* make this strict and allow only that user to set that reviewBy flag...
answer: ## Credit Props to https://twitter.com/lilyraynyc for the idea.

post:
Thread.exit considered harmful

I would like to deprecate/remove Thread.exit, because it prevents writing resource-safe code. When a resource is not handled by the GC (for whatever reason), a standard way of allocating it for a limited period of time is to use Fun.protect (or a ad-hoc re-implementation thereof). This function guarantees that the finally function it is given as parameter will be executed at the end of the execution of the other given closure. However, Thread.exit breaks this invariant, since it can terminate the current thread even before the finally function is run. Not only Thread.exit makes it impossible to use reliably such programming idiom, but it also incompatible with GC-based finalizers. Indeed, if Thread.exit is run from within a finalizer, then the running_finalisation_function will never be reset, which results in finalizers no longer be run at all by the program! I have related problems for my implementation of Statmemprof. There is an easy way to replace Thread.exit: simply throw a dedicated exception and catch it at the entry point of the thread. Note that some recent programming languages (e.g., Rust), do not provide such a thread exit function. What Rust provide, panic, does perform stack unwinding for cleaning resources. I know this proposal is likely to be polemic, hence I am not opening a PR, and wait for thoughts of other OCaml developers here. Cc @gadmm, who nowadays thinks a lot about resource safety in OCaml. Note that the same issue exists when a thread calls Unix.fork : in this case, all threads but one is killed, which causes the same problem as described above.
question: Did you investigate library usage on opam ? E.g. see [here](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/pull/8873#issuecomment-521311078) on how to get a source sample.
answer: Note that the same issue exists when a thread calls Unix.fork : in this case, all threads but one is killed, which causes the same problem as described above.

post: Show last visible status order on order history page **EDIT** On front office > customer order history page, show the last visible order status. At some point of the order flow, it might get a specific order status that the merchant decides not to display to the customer (option available in the status configuration). When the order gets this status, nothing is displayed in the customer account, which can create confusion for the customer. With this improvement, it will show in the customer account the last status the order had before getting this "invisible" status. Edge case : if the first status an order gets is "invisible" for the customer, then show nothing. **Initial description :** We received some complains from customer that can't see the order-status on the order history page. Our reply was always its there, or click on details. I never understood why they where not seeing anything until I realised that we use statuses that are invisible for the customers. Once an order is shipped, we change status for administrations reasons. The customer does not need to see this status. When the status is not there, customers think that their order was not processed and think they have to reorder. It causes a bit of confusion. I attached a screenshot with two orders. One order is cancelled, the other is put in to the next status phase. As you can see its empty ( status will show up once you click on details ). Request: show on the order history page the last visible status for customer. Just like in the order detail page. Prestashop 1.7.6.5
question: Can you tell us which payment status are invisible and what PrestaShop version did you use? Thank you :)
answer: **EDIT** On front office > customer order history page, show the last visible order status. At some point of the order flow, it might get a specific order status that the merchant decides not to display to the customer (option available in the status configuration). When the order gets this status, nothing is displayed in the customer account, which can create confusion for the customer. With this improvement, it will show in the customer account the last status the order had before getting this "invisible" status. Edge case : if the first status an order gets is "invisible" for the customer, then show nothing. **Initial description :**

post:
Improvement - Add an option in the cart rule to Apply discount on the original subtotal or not

**Improvement** Apply a discount on the original subtotal is the choice we need. From what I see in other systems this is usually a dropdown which says Apply on: [Original Subtotal] [Subtotal] **Describe the bug** I've created two rules that give a discount 8% and 2%. The amount in my cart is 57.35 so the discount should be 5.735 and the total should be calculated as 57.35 - 5.735 = 51.615 On the contrary prestashop is doing the calculations on the already discounted price thus ending up with a smaller discount for the customer. So in succession it's calculating 57.35 - 8% = 52.762 -2% = 51.70676 There is no option to configure this on the backend whether you want to do it this way or the other way but the thing is if the discounts are not calculated based on the original subtotal it's going to be very confusing for the users. Because the administrator is going to have to consider rule priority in order to give the correct discount amount and the customers will definitely nag because they think the discount doesn't add up. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: - create 2 discount rules for 8% and 2% excluding shipping - create a product with value 57.35 - go to cart and notice this cart result with the two discounts applied ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20220341/65612112-70c03080-dfbc-11e9-824f-0217cb05d804.png) - Furthermore the discount amount is also incorrectly calculated. It should be the difference between the two amounts so at least it should say 4.588 + 1.05524 = 5.64324 which is approximately 57.35 (subtotal) - 51.71 (total) **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots or screenrecords to help explain your problem. **Additional information** PrestaShop version:1.7.5.2 - 1.7.6.1 PHP version: 7.2 Recommended solution in my opinion: Add an option to cart rules "Apply to" with two options - Apply on subtotal - Apply on discounted subtotal In either case this scenario which is very common in B2B won't work as it is now. And in any case the discount amount should be calculated correctly. I can't even begin to understand which calculation shows 7 as discount amount. Kind regards
question: What do you think? it is an improvement & not a bug Thanks!
answer: **Improvement** Apply a discount on the original subtotal is the choice we need. From what I see in other systems this is usually a dropdown which says Apply on: [Original Subtotal] [Subtotal]

Shipping price is deducted twice **Screenshots** ![two shipping vouchers](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55688534/75459019-0a7e7600-597f-11ea-9dae-f38ed7e3eee4.png) **Additional information** PrestaShop version: 1.7.7 PHP version: N/A
question: Do we need to implement [the proposal of Hlavtox](https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/issues/16642)? team what do you think? Thank you for reading.
answer: and BO on FO

post:
[Linux] Move + overwrite does upload + delete instead of server MOVE

### Steps 1. Create a file "b.txt" with contents 1. Wait for sync 1. Create a file "a.txt" with contents 1. Wait for sync 1. mv a.txt b.txt 1. Wait for sync 1. Check activity ### Expected result Server MOVE ### Actual result ~~The file "b.txt" is first uploaded, and then "a.txt" is deleted instead of MOVE.~~ First "a.txt" is deleted and then "b.txt" is uploaded, instead of MOVE. ### Version Observed on 2.5.1 by me and on 2.5.4 daily by @jnweiger ### Env My env is openSUSE Tumbleweed 20190126 with owncloud-client-2.5.1.10973-1.1.x86_64 Note: I don't think it's a problem with inotify as I only have about 1300 entries in my local folder. @guruz
question: Maybe still a client bug then when messing around with SyncFileItem? EDIT: ignore this comment, maybe it's not related to FileId anyway..
answer: ~~ instead of MOVE.~~ First "a.txt" is deleted and then "b.txt" is uploaded,

post:
2.6.0 Alpha1 virtual files mode - no preview/thumbnails in explorer for locally available files

No previews for images etc. in windows explorer for downloaded files in owncloud virtual files mode. ### Expected behaviour Explorer should display previews for downloaded files. ### Actual behaviour Explorer only displays preview for files i just uploaded (just dropped into the sync folder). ![right after dropping files in sync folder](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13625968/57185758-8a5bc100-6ed1-11e9-9878-52fa628d7782.png) After refreshing explorer (F5, close and reopen etc.), previews for all files are gone. ![after refresh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13625968/57185762-a3647200-6ed1-11e9-9869-1dad84f1ee04.png) No previews for any downloaded files. ### Steps to reproduce 0. Enable virtual files mode 1. Drag'n'drop image in sync folder. 2. Preview will be displayed. 3. Refresh explorer. 4. Preview disappears. 5. No preview for any file downloaded file. ### Server configuration Operating system: Ubuntu 18.10 Web server: Apache 2 Database: MySql PHP version: 7.2 ownCloud version: 10.1.1 ### Client configuration Client version: 2.6.0 Alpha 1 Operating system: Windows 10 Pro Using Windows 10 1809 (Buildnumber 17763). I have a second machine running Windows 10 LTSC Build 17763, exact same behaviour. OS language: DE Qt version used by client package (Linux only, see also Settings dialog): - Client package (From ownCloud or distro) (Linux only): - Installation path of client: C:\program files (X86)
question: What is the exact version / build of your Win 10 Pro?
answer: Using Windows 10 1809 (Buildnumber 17763). I have a second machine running Windows 10 LTSC Build 17763, exact same behaviour.

post:
mpv crashes with hardware acceleration enabled

### mpv version and platform - mpv version: 0.32.0  - macOS version: 10.15.3 - source of the mpv binary or bundle: https://laboratory.stolendata.net/~djinn/mpv_osx/mpv-0.32.0.tar.gz ### Reproduction steps 1. Enable hardware acceleration. Put the hwdec=auto setting into the configuration file ~/.config/mpv/mpv.conf. 2. Launch the mpv app. 3. Choose the File > Open... menu option. Select the provided sample file, then click Open. ### Expected behavior Playback starts. ### Actual behavior The app crashes. ### Note The crash occurs not on all machines. The app crashes on: - Macmini6,2 with Intel HD Graphics 4000 1536 MB; - MacBookPro14,3 with Radeon Pro 560. ~~The app does not crash on:~~ ~~- Macmini8,1 with Intel UHD Graphics 630 1536 MB.~~ **UPD:** After I updated Macmini8,1 from macOS 10.15.2 to 10.15.3, mpv began to crash on it. It seems that the issue was introduced in macOS 10.15.3. ### Log file [mvp-MacBookPro14,3.log](https://github.com/mpv-player/mpv/files/4254887/mvp-MacBookPro14.3-RadeonPro.560.log) [mpv-Macmini6,2.log](https://github.com/mpv-player/mpv/files/4255641/mpv-Macmini6.2.log) mpv prints to the log file the following information  ... and then crashes. ### Crash Reports https://0x0.st/iq0o.zip  ### Sample files https://0x0.st/iqIq.ts mpv also crashes when seeking in the file: https://0x0.st/iqlG.mts

RFC: Further GitHub labeling improvements

### Description This issue follows on from https://github.com/RIOT-OS/RIOT/issues/10030. That issue deals only with re-naming current labels, but during the discussion, a number of further points of action are being brought up. These will be captured below. Feel free to add more points yourself (but preferably not delete). ### Further labeling actions: - [ ] Add further labels proposed during that discussion. A couple of suggestions: - State: under review - State: inactive - State: blocked - Priority: {high|low|medium} - Review requirement: light - Review requirement: thorough - Type: security flaw - [ ] Issue triaging: sorting and re-labelling issues - [ ] Extracting useful information for the CI (show warning if there's a new feature with no test, not test everything if there's only a change in documentation, etc). - [ ] Automated label-setting
question: Do the State: xxxxxxx labels are automatically set by some kind of scripts or should they be set by maintainers ?
answer: - [ ] Automated label-setting

post: Clearing specific quill fields using a button I am fairly new to Quilljs. So, please bare with me as I attempt to describe my needs. I am using Quilljs 1.3.6. I want to add a button on an HTML form that will clear specific quilljs fields. If I use jquery on any non-quilljs field, all I have to do is create a button that calls a javascript function, that deletes the field(s). For example: HTML <label for="strengths">How strong are you?<label> <input type='text' name='strengths' id='strengths'> <input type="button" onclick="clearTextField()">Clear Field</button> Javascript File function clearTextField() { $('#strengths').val(''); } How do I clear a quilljs field? I would like to do something like this: HTML <label for="strengths">How strong are you?<label> <input type="hidden" name="strengths"> <div id="strengths-container"> <p>Blah Blah Blah</p> </div> <input type="button" onclick="clearTextField()">Clear Field</button> Javascript File function clearTextField() { strengths.setContents([]); } However, this won't work, because: var strengths = new Quill("#strengths-container", { modules: { toolbar: toolbaroptions }, theme: "snow" }); function clearTextField() { $('#strengths').val(''); } was created in a different function. So, the scope of the object is limited to the that function. Is there a way clear the contents of a field with quilljs, separate from the function that instantiated the object?
question: What do you mean by a field? Quill have full control of the DOM and expose an API to update the [contents](https://quilljs.com/docs/api/#content) and [formats](https://quilljs.com/docs/api/#formatting), you shouldn't access it directly.
answer: label for="strengths"<How strong are you?> <HTML <label for="strengths"<How strong are you?> <div id="strengths-container"> <p>Blah Blah Blah</p> </div> <input type="button" onclick="clearTextField()">Clear Field</button> <b>Javascript File</b>

They uses different types of editor such as pgadmin,dbeaver,notepad++ All was good in 4.2.0 until we decided to upgrade to 6.2.2 to fix a security issue which popped up due to 2 of the DB drivers present in the flyway db. Once we upgraded, the security issue was resolved as the 6.2.2 version of flyway was using latest versions of the drivers but we started facing this "unable to calculate checksum" issue. Then we had to downgrade it back to 4.2.0 and decided to remove the drivers from the pack which were causing the security issues. Removal of the drivers from the image solved the problem but we want to upgrade the flyway now so that we don't have to remove the drivers ###### What did you expect to see? The expectation is that this issue should not pop up as we can't go and correct the type conversion to UTF-8 for each and every file. For lot of files used for different engines and modules we are facing this. Even we tried to convert one problematic file to UTF-8 in notepad++ but we were still receiving the same error. We have lot of SQL files checked in for last few years and now they have grown up so much that we can't go and correct each of them or ask our engineers to correct them and also we don't even know how the file changes will impact the upgrade process in customer environments using our product and also as I said we are not sure also that the issue will be resolved post the changes of UTF-8 conversion. Any configuration tweak may also help if there is a way so that this error can be bypassed. ###### What did you see instead? post:
Installing NLog.Config and NLog.Schema in a .NET Core project in Visual Studio 15.7.x and/or NuGet 4.7.x does not copy the files in the project root

**Update:** The issue seems to be tied to the version of Visual Studio and/or NuGet too, see [below](https://github.com/NLog/NLog/issues/2823#issuecomment-410200808). # How to reproduce the problem Add the NLog, NLog.Config and NLog.Schema packages to a .NET Core 2.1 Console Application project. # Expected behaviour The XML and XSD files from NLog.Config and NLog.Schema are copied in the project root. # Actual behaviour The files are not copied to the project root, instead they are somehow "virtually linked" there (there's no "link" at file system level) from the NuGet packages cache directories. # Why this is a problem 1. The content of the files are shared between all projects using the packages: if I modify the XML in project A, project B will see the same changes since the physical file is the same. 1. If the XML and the XSD are not besides each other, IntelliSense will not pick up the schema and won't provide any autocompletion. The first problem is especially nasty since it affects every projects that is using the packages, and there's absolutely no warning about it. # Related issues #2461, #2686, #2757 Maybe related to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference#package-compatibility-issues as suggested in #2757. # Platforms - Visual Studio: Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2017 Version 15.7.5 - ReSharper: JetBrains ReSharper Ultimate 2018.1.3 Build 112.0.20180626.160528 - Framework: .NET Core 2.1 - Target framework: netcoreapp2.1 - Project type: Console application - Project SDK: Microsoft.NET.Sdk # Packages versions - NLog: 4.5.7 - NLog.Config: 4.5.7 - NLog.Schema: 4.5.7 # Screenshots Installing the packages adds "virtual files": ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249988/43454512-98e709b2-94bd-11e8-8af9-bdf8e8d7049e.png) The files are "linked" from the NuGet packages cache: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249988/43454565-c799ad3c-94bd-11e8-86bf-7967dc9e084f.png) The packages have been added through PackageReference: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249988/43454597-db6bccc8-94bd-11e8-8212-ca61aadfe3e2.png) The files are not copied in the project root: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249988/43454932-b78f7a42-94be-11e8-9770-cbba52dc47ae.png) IntelliSense will not pick up the XSD schema, and the XML file is shared between every project: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249988/43455268-a1da36d2-94bf-11e8-88d0-6b22c9f9de05.png) (The XML file in the screenshot has not been yet modified _in this project_, yet its content is not the default one but the modified one from another project.)
question: Does anyone has an idea what needs to be changed in the nuspec to get this working?
answer: **Update:** The issue seems to be tied to the version of Visual Studio and/or NuGet too, see [below](https://github.com/NLog/NLog/issues/2823#issuecomment-410200808).

post:
"OSError: cannot open resource" when trying to load more than exactly 509 ImageFonts

### What did you do? For a data generator, I need to use lots of fonts in different sizes. Randomly one of that is used to generate a sample. Since I didn't want to load a font every time we generate a sample, I created a nested dictionary that dynamicalle loads fonts of a given size when it wasn't loaded previously. It worked fine at the beginning. Then I tried to generate some more samples (>1k) and got "OSError: cannot open resource" every time. I double checked the paths and tried to load the font with the same path and that worked just fine. It definitely isn't related to the path encoding bugs. To reproduce that, you can use the code below. ### What did you expect to happen? It should be able to load fonts until the RAM is full ;) ### What actually happened? OSError after loading exactly 509 fonts. After clearing my dictionary as soon as the error occurs (temporary workaround), it works fine again. ### What are your OS, Python and Pillow versions? * OS: Win10 * Python: 3.6 * Pillow: 5.4.1 Please include **code** that reproduces the issue and whenever possible, an **image** that demonstrates the issue. Please upload images to GitHub, not to third-party file hosting sites. If necessary, add the image to a zip or tar archive. post:
Font spacing changes

### What did you do? 1. I'm using Pillow to create many individual images which I then stitch together to create a lyrics video for a song. - The app is online at https://www.rhymecraft.guru 1. One of the features of the videos created by my app is that, while showing an entire line of lyrics on-screen at once, the currently-pronounced syllable can be highlighted. - You can see an example here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9u9ylseLAfU 1. The way I achieve this is by: 1. first calculating where the X, Y coordinates of the line would start if the entire line of lyrics was drawn at once 1. then drawing the text *preceding* the highlighted syllable and recording the width of that text, 1. then drawing the highlighted syllable, using the original X, Y coordinates and the width of the preceding text to calculate where the highlighted syllable's X, Y coordinates should start, 1. then proceeding in the same way to draw the text following the highlighted syllable. ### What did you expect to happen? I expected that the current syllable would change color without any other visible changes. ### What actually happened? The text spacing always doesn't seem to work totally right, so the lyrics sometimes get spaced out. You can see it: - caused by the word 'of' at 0:47: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9u9ylseLAfU&t=47s - in the word 'paradise' at 1:03: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9u9ylseLAfU&t=1m3s ### What are your OS, Python and Pillow versions? * OS: Windows 10 (local machine), Ubuntu (Digital Ocean) * Python: 3.7 * Pillow: 5.0.0 Example code:  There's first a red 'paradise' created, then a white 'paradise' created in the same spot. post:
(csharpsquid:S1244) Comparison of floating point values with 0 / zero should be allowed

### Description The rule "csharpsquid:S1244" should not complain on comparison of floating point values to exact zero. https://rules.sonarsource.com/csharp/RSPEC-1244 The values: 0, NaN and Infinity are well defined state of a float point number so there is no need for checking this values within a delta. E.g the Sign(0) function is 0 and only 0 for 0! ### Repro steps float f = 0.0; if (f == 0) { // <-- S1244 } if (f != 0) { // <-- S1244 } ### Expected behavior No sharpsquid:S1244 for zero checks. ### Actual behavior "Do not check floating point inequality with exact values, use a range instead." ### Known workarounds float f = 0.0; if ((System.Math.Sign(f) == 0)) { } ### Related information * SonarC# SonarQube Version Version 6.7.6 (build 38781) (Web UI)

post:
[java] AccessorClassGeneration false-negative: subclass calls private constructor

Rule: [AccessorClassGeneration](https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_rules_java_bestpractices.html#accessorclassgeneration) Possibly a false-negative. Having a sub-class that calls a private constructor is bad practice. It requires the compiler adding another package-private synthetic constructor with an additional synthetic anonymous inner class parameter that forwards to the private constructor so that the subclass has something non-private to call. Examples for this would be for example  where the default constructor of Bar calls the private no-arg constructor of Foo or  where the call to the private constructor is explicit. This adds unnecessarily additional constructors and also can cause problems if you use the class from Groovy code, as in the first example new Foo(null) and in the second example new Foo(null, null) can not be executed as there is a disambiguity between the constructor you meant to call and the synthetic added constructor. It is usually better practice to simply make that constructor package-private direclty, eliminating the need for any synthetic constructors.
question: Could you please confirm this and update the report accordingly?
answer: Rule: [AccessorClassGeneration](https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_rules_java_bestpractices.html#accessorclassgeneration) Possibly a false-negative.

When removed, sound stops. When this audio happens, it seems as though it uses all audio channels (voices?) available on the sound device as all other audio gets either muted/nulled or clips horribly. For example, chests will only play thier open/close sounds maybe 20% of the time and when they do the sound isn't fully played.~~ #### Edit end Hitting the windows key (super/mod4) also causes "notifications" (debug info?) to show. Note, I have all MPS keys unbound. Binding them to any key still causes win/super/mod4 to act the same. I'm running on Arch Linux, while the person in the video (shazzba) is running Windows 10. post:
Feature request: per-task event handlers

<!--- We use GitHub issues mainly for tracking bugs and feature requests. Questions for how to use luigi can be sent to the mailing list. Currently, there are no strict procedures or guidelines for submitting issues. In short, please just use common sense. Common sense includes this at bare-minimum: * search for similar issues posted before creating a new issue. * Use markdown to format all code/logs. Issues which are hard to read when rendered on GitHub might be closed with a friendly reminder of this. * If applicable, reading relevant parts of the documentation. Also, add steps to reproduce the bug, if applicable. Sample code would be nice too :) For more information on how to submit valuable contributions, see https://opensource.guide/how-to-contribute/#how-to-submit-a-contribution --> Hi. I'd like to be able to have some way of reacting to events of a single task instance, instead of every instance of a task class. I guess I could define event handlers on the task's class which check for the specific signature/id of the particular task instance I want, but then there's no way to unregister the handler, so this is not viable. The context is that I'm implementing a websocket api for triggering tasks(through luigi.interface.build), and I want to send a message once the task is done(or failed). I don't know of any way to track a task execution other than the class-based events. I'm going to implement this myself on my base task class, but I guess this would be a valuable feature to have natively in Luigi?
question: What do you think?
answer: I don't know of any way to track a task execution other than the class-based events.m

post:
Allow servers to take full responsibility of cross-origin resource protection

Some servers want to completely opt out of cross-origin request protection, as evidenced by https://enable-cors.org/. This is a common use case. Unfortunately, the there described way of opting out has recently been broken due to tightened security, as discussed in https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/862. Client applications stopped working, and the solution was at the server side. So https://enable-cors.org/ needs to be extended, and servers have to be reconfigured. This will take years to propagate. To make matters worse, security can be tightened again at any point in the future, which will again break apps, and force new server-side changes. I therefore propose the introduction of a header where the server states it will assume full responsibility of cross-origin resource protection, which is a future-proof way of opting out of any such protection on the client side. Servers who do not require any protection (think open data), or servers who have their own protection mechanisms (various forms of auth) will prefer that option to keep on working indefinitely. Servers with other needs can still resort to client-side protection and more granular CORS headers.
question: What is needed to get this issue on a high priority list?
answer: origin resource protection, which is a future-proof way of opting out of any such protection on the client side. Servers who do not require any protection (think open data), or servers who have their own protection mechanisms (various forms of auth) will prefer that option to keep on working indefinitely. Servers with other needs can still resort to client-side protection and more granular

post:
pip-compile bumps setuptools within commented-out spec

If you have a `requirements.in` which contains a package which depends on `setuptools`, for example:
```
$ cat requirements.in 
protobuf  # or google-api-core, ipython, pandas-gbq, pydata-google-auth
```
Then after running `pip-compile`, you get:
```
$ cat requirements.txt
#
# This file is autogenerated by pip-compile
# To update, run:
#
#    pip-compile
#
protobuf==3.10.0
six==1.12.0               # via protobuf

# The following packages are considered to be unsafe in a requirements file:
# setuptools==41.4.0        # via protobuf
```

As you can see, `pip-compile` refuses to include `setuptools` directly in a generated `requirements.txt`, instead adding a section with the comment "The following packages are considered to be unsafe in a requirements file:".
This behaviour is fine in the general (and I don't disagree with the comment or behaviour).

However because the commented out `setuptools` line includes a version number, when `setuptools` releases an update then the `requirements.txt` file ends up looking out of date.

Say you had committed a `requirements.txt` which looked like:
```
# requirements...

# The following packages are considered to be unsafe in a requirements file:
# setuptools==41.4.0        # via protobuf
```

Then `setuptools` releases `41.5.0` and now when you run `pip-compile` you get:
```
# requirements...

# The following packages are considered to be unsafe in a requirements file:
# setuptools==41.5.0        # via protobuf
```

This is inconvenient if you happen to regenerate your `requirements.txt` at some point after an upstream releases, however if you're also using `pip-compile` to check that your `requirements.txt` is in step with your `requirements.in` (see #882) in CI then it means that your build now fails for what is essentially a non-change.

I'm not sure what the right solution is here, though perhaps if there was a way for pip-compile to understand its own commented out dependency that might help?
question: Could you add more details, attach the `requirements.txt`, provide commands you run?
answer:

```

std::string::find usage inconsistent

`if (!content_type.find("application/x-www-form-urlencoded"))`
 is intended, an explanation should be provided.
Note: in this particular case, I think it's a mistake as of lines 1627, 2692, 3228.
question: Could you give me the smallest possible code example to cause the problem? Thanks!
answer:
).
> IMHO it should be:
> `if (content_type.find("application/x-www-form-urlencoded") == 0)`
> otherwise you take `content_type.find("application/x-www-form-urlencoded") == std::string::npos)`
> as a valid - this should not be the case

post:
How to implement an object system in Terra?

Hi! Me again :)

I'm trying to implement an object system on top of Terra that allows both overriding and overloading and I can't seem to find a way to do it, despite a week of struggling. 

I should probably mention that my intention at first was _not_ to write a language extension since I don't want to introduce new syntax, but I went down that road because I couldn't do what I wanted with existing metamethods. In particular, I need to control what happens when a new method is defined in order to implement auto-overloading behavior, see #336 (I also wanted metamethods for assignments in order to implement properties - see #340, ~~but I gave up on that~~ update: that was solved).

So by making a language extension I thought I could implement auto-overloading easily, but that added in more problems. First, you can't just create a bunch of interdependent Terra functions because the eager type-checking will bail on recursive references. You can't stub them all and add the body on a second phase with `resetdefinition()` either because there's no API to get the return type of a quote (#339) so you'd have to give up return-type inference. Another thing I tried was to build dependent methods on a `__methodmissing` hook, but there's no API to select an overloaded definition from an overloadedterrafunction object given a set of arg types (probably what `tryinsertcasts` does), so you wouldn't know how to return the right definition. 

I also studied javalike.t and it is using an undocumented "sturct constructor" syntax which receives the newly created type at a very convenient moment when all methods are specialized but not yet compiled, which allows the entire methods table to be replaced with vtable stubs and everything just works afterwards. This is a luxury I don't have when creating functions "by hand" I suspect because of eager type-checking. An API to pause and resume compilation (i.e., enable/disable eager type checking) might help here, if I understand the issue correctly that is.

There's always the option of making a parallel language from scratch that compiles to Terra but I would end up with a second Terra implementation with semantics slightly off, and a lot of code duplication. So the idea of gradually extending Terra is much more appealing to me, but I think that more of Terra's guts would have to be exposed for that. 

I'm open to suggestions on how to do this differently of course :)
question: What are you actually trying to achieve overall?  Why do you think you need overloading?  Does your overloading need to be run-time or compile-time?  Etc... Etc...  :-)
answer: ~~~~ update: that was solved

post:
`cut -c3- ~/.tmux.conf | sh -s _apply_configuration` returned X

In relation to #149, #201, #238 and #256, and due to this happening for both me and a colleague, running `.tmux.conf` failed for the following line:

`cut -c3- ~/.tmux.conf | sh -s _apply_configuration`

I think it's related to what default shell is set - mine was set to `bash`, and it was stubborn even after a reboot (even after `chsh` - go figure!). Changing the line to the following worked for me (note `sh` changed to `zsh`) (**EDIT**: don't do this, read @gpakosz's commentary below re branch `gh-254`):

`cut -c3- ~/.tmux.conf | zsh -s _apply_configuration`

Would this be worth a pull request? Or does this change have some side effects? There are other `| sh -c` lines that might also benefit from being changed to `| zsh -c`, although I haven't tested.
question:

```
$ cut -c3- ~/.tmux.conf | sh -sx _apply_configuration > /tmp/log.txt 2>&1

iOS 13 - Bluetooth keyboard arrow keys not working

# Bug Report

## Problem

The arrow keys (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT) of the external bluetooth keyboard do not work in iOS 13. It was working fine in earlier versions.  Other keys are working fine. 

Note that, the arrow keys work fine in other iOS native apps. Also, the issue exists only with the UIWebView. The WKWebView works fine.

### What is expected to happen?
The Arrow keys of the external keyboard should work fine.


### What does actually happen?
The Arrow keys of the external keyboard are not working.


## Information
<!-- Include all relevant information that might help understand and reproduce the problem -->
I see the following console error in Xcode when I press one of the arrow keys.

```
2019-09-17 16:06:08.114428-0500 My_APP_NAME[375:30929] -[UIThreadSafeNode canPerformAction:withSender:]: unrecognized selector sent to instance 0x283523040
2019-09-17 16:06:08.115002-0500 My_APP_NAME[375:30929] *** WebKit discarded an uncaught exception in the handleKeyTextCommandForCurrentEvent delegate: <NSInvalidArgumentException> -[UIThreadSafeNode canPerformAction:withSender:]: unrecognized selector sent to instance 0x283523040

How to remove the text Timestamp when saving pandas DataFrame as Dictionary?

Hi Microblog Community,

This question isn't directly related to any lessons from the Microblog book tutorial. But it derives from its lessons.

I need to save a pandas DataFrame as Dictionary in order to push my data into my database using Flask SQLAlchemy. But even when I change the DataType for column **Time** from Datetime to Object. My dictionary variable still contains the **text Timestamp**, how can I remove this text and parenthesis characters from my dictionary?

> ufo_dict_2
> 
> {0: {'City': 'Ithaca', 'Colors Reported': nan, 'Shape Reported': 'TRIANGLE', 'State': 'NY', 'Time': **Timestamp(**'1930-06-01 22:00:00'**)**}}

.

Below is my experiment code to reproduce in terminal what I have tried so far:

**x13_change_DataType_for_Series.py**
```
import pandas as pd

#_______________________________________________________________________________

ufo = pd.read_csv('http://bit.ly/uforeports')

print("")
print(ufo.head())
print("")
print(type(ufo))
print("")
print("ufo.dtypes")
print(ufo.dtypes)

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

# Convert DataFrame to Dictionary.

ufo_dict_0 = ufo.to_dict('index')

print("ufo_dict_0")
print("")
print(dict(list(ufo_dict_0.items())[0:3]))
print("")
print(type(ufo_dict_0))

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

# Convert Time datatype from Object to Datetime.

ufo['Time'] = pd.to_datetime(ufo.Time)

print(ufo.head())
print("")
print(type(ufo))
print("")
print("ufo.dtypes")
print(ufo.dtypes)

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

# Convert DataFrame to Dictionary.

ufo_dict_1 = ufo.to_dict('index')

print("ufo_dict_1")
print("")
print(dict(list(ufo_dict_1.items())[0:3]))
print("")
print(type(ufo_dict_1))

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

# Convert Time datatype from Datetime to Object.

# data[utc_time] = data.utc_time.astype(object)
ufo['Time'] = ufo.Time.astype(object)

print(ufo.head())
print("")
print(type(ufo))
print("")
print("ufo.dtypes")
print(ufo.dtypes)

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

# Convert DataFrame to Dictionary.

ufo_dict_2 = ufo.to_dict('index')

print("ufo_dict_2")
print("")
print(dict(list(ufo_dict_2.items())[0:3]))
print("")
print(type(ufo_dict_2))

print("")
print("_______________________________________________________________________")
print("")

#_______________________________________________________________________________

```
question: What type is your timestamp? My guess is that this object prints itself with the format `Timestamp(...)` so that is what you see when you print the dict.

post:
megaclisas-status

Hi there,

if you have some time, please take a look at megaclisas-status for the LSI Megaraid controllers.
I think that megaclisas-status provides much more and more precise data.
Megaclisas-status shows e.g. also the rebuild or initialization status which megasasctl does not do.
Here's an example:
megaclisas-status.txt
```
-- Controller information --
-- ID | H/W Model         | RAM    | Temp | BBU    | Firmware

post:
Cannot trigger deffered deeplink

I'm trying to test deffered deeplink functionality on android. I'm using project on which deffered deeplinks are working correctly on iOS.

My steps:
1) Stop, clean, remove android app
2) Open http://app.adjust.com/forget_device?app_token=(appToken)&adid=(device_adid) -> gives communicate "Forgot device"
3) On android device open link (via email or neocities.org) taken from adjust app center -> project -> tracker -> edit -> CLICK URL
4) Install and open app

At this point I get session and attribution but attribution does not have deeplink. Instead of attribution from 3) I get this:
```
 {
	"app_token": "...",
	"adid": "{correct adid}",
	"timestamp": "...",
	"message": "Attribution found",
	"attribution": {
		"tracker_token": "{tracker token not visible in project}d",
		"tracker_name": "Organic",
		"network": "Organic"
	}
}
```

I tried both ENVIRONMENT_SANDBOX and ENVIRONMENT_PRODUCTION. Also I have 
```
config.setOnDeeplinkResponseListener{
//dummyLog
            true
        } 
```
in my code, although I tried to run it without this part since it's a default value anyway.

Can you spot my error? Do I miss any steps? 

PS. If I run CLICK URL link with installed app then deeplink works correctly
question: How does the tracker URL you're clicking onto look like (feel free to omit sensitive parts from it)?
answer: PS. If I run CLICK URL link with installed app then deeplink works correctly
